output_data.clarification_question: Please provide the total documented time for this combined psychotherapy and medication management session. Time is the controlling factor for selecting the correct E/M and psychotherapy add-on codes.
output_data.suggested_answer: If this was a typical follow-up session lasting between 45 and 55 minutes, with the majority of the time dedicated to counseling and therapy (30+ minutes), we would assign CPT codes 99214 and 90836.

primary_code.description: Established patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 30-39 minutes total time (or based on high complexity)
primary_code.rationale: The session involved complex decision-making (medication dose adjustment from 50mg to 100mg of *Sertraline*) and management of a high-risk factor (*passive suicidal ideation*), warranting high medical decision complexity (Level 4 E/M), but the time needs confirmation.

addon_codes.description: Psychotherapy, 45 minutes with an E/M service
addon_codes.rationale: The discussion included detailed psychosocial exploration, safety assessment, addressing feelings of *guilt* and *failure*, and therapeutic support necessary for symptom management, qualifying for the combined psychotherapy add-on (30 minutes minimum required).

output_data.medical_necessity: Management of *Recurrent Major Depressive Disorder, Moderate (F33.1)* complicated by dose titration and passive suicidal ideation. The need for safety assessment and psychoeducation dictates the complexity.
